centralQuestion: Should governments implement universal basic income?

reasons.description: UBI can reduce poverty by providing a stable income floor.

sources.title: The New York Times: 'The Case for Universal Basic Income'
Pew Research Center: 'What Public Opinion Polls Say About UBI'

reasons.description: UBI may encourage entrepreneurship by reducing financial risk.

sources.title: World Economic Forum: 'Universal Basic Income as a Catalyst for Entrepreneurship'
Brookings Institution: 'Universal Basic Income and Innovation'

reasons.description: UBI simplifies the welfare system and reduces bureaucratic inefficiency.

sources.title: The Atlantic: 'Why UBI Makes Welfare More Efficient'

reasons.description: UBI may improve mental and physical health by reducing financial stress.

sources.title: Project Syndicate: 'The Health Case for Basic Income'

objections.description: UBI could disincentivize work for some recipients.

sources.title: Wall Street Journal: 'The Risks of a Universal Basic Income'
BBC: 'Universal Basic Income: Does It Discourage Work?'

objections.description: It may be too expensive to sustain without major tax increases or cuts to other programs.

sources.title: Brookings Institution: 'Why Universal Basic Income is a Bad Idea'

objections.description: UBI could crowd out more targeted welfare programs for the most vulnerable.

sources.title: Carnegie Endowment for International Peace: 'The Problem With UBI'

objections.description: There is limited evidence from pilots that UBI works at a national scale.

sources.title: RAND Corporation: 'Universal Basic Income: What Do the Data Say?'

research.title: The Macroeconomics of Universal Basic Income Programs
research.description: This article discusses the fiscal feasibility, macroeconomic impacts, and welfare implications of implementing UBI in advanced economies.

research.title: Universal Basic Income: A Review
research.description: A systematic review of empirical evidence from UBI pilots across multiple countries, assessing labor market outcomes, health, and well-being.

research.title: Exploring the Costs and Benefits of Universal Basic Income
research.description: Analyzes the fiscal cost, economic redistribution effects, and potential policy trade-offs of UBI using simulation models.

research.title: Effects of Basic Income Policies in Developed Countries: Evidence from Pilot Programs
research.description: Reviews outcome data from North American and European basic income experiments, focusing on work incentives and subjective well-being.
